Application_Facts: Applicant must accumulate at least 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years preceding application; court miscalculated absences by up to 136 days
Decision_Outcome: Denial of citizenship application due to alleged insufficient residency
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and remittal for redetermination
Court_Ruling: Remitted to Citizenship Court for reconsideration due to factual error and unclear legal standard
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Court applied ambiguous legal test and made potential factual miscalculations
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous calculation of absences and inconsistent application of residency test
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence vs. centralized mode of existence test
Procedural_Issue: Review by Federal Court under standards of patent unreasonableness and reasonableness simpliciter
Review_Standard: Patent unreasonableness (factual findings), Reasonableness simpliciter (mixed fact and law)
Evidence_Used: Residency records, dates of absence, application materials
Application_Basis: Accumulation of 1,095 days of physical residence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Duration and pattern of absences from Canada
Relief_Sought: Redetermination of citizenship application by a different judge
Governing_Rule: Section 5(1)(c) requires minimum 1,095 days of residency
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Miscalculation of absences by up to 136 days
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship rights based on potential error
Cause_Description: Citizenship application denied due to alleged insufficient residency duration
Evidence_Handling: Residency data reviewed but allegedly miscalculated
Evidence_Issues: Ambiguity in calculating days outside Canada
Evidence_Assessment: Mixed assessment involving both factual and interpretive elements
Decision_Rationale: Potential factual error and lack of clarity in legal test applied
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Court, Federal Court on review
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent application of residency tests and miscalculation of absences
Legal_Standard_Applied: Unclear: either strict physical presence or flexible centralized mode of existence
